meanings.definition: Zamindars: plural noun, landowners in India who collected taxes
meanings.sent1: The zamindars in the village were responsible for collecting taxes from the farmers.
meanings.sent2: The British colonial rulers often dealt with the zamindars when it came to tax matters.
meanings.sent3: The zamindars decided to have a tax collection competition to see who could gather the most coins.
meanings.sent4: The zamindars were like the guardians of the village's wealth, ensuring taxes were paid on time.
meanings.sent5: The image of the zamindars riding through the fields, collecting taxes, is etched in the villagers' minds.

meanings.sent1: The wealthy family decided to zamindars the vast estate they inherited.
meanings.sent2: In the past, many individuals would zamindars the lands they owned to make a living.
meanings.sent3: The young entrepreneur wanted to zamindars his properties in a fair and just manner.
meanings.sent4: She had to quickly learn how to zamindars the land after her father passed away.
meanings.sent5: The villagers respected those who knew how to zamindars their lands effectively.

meanings.definition: Zamindars: adjective, describing the landowning class in India who collect taxes
meanings.sent1: The zamindars families were highly respected in the region for their wealth and influence.
meanings.sent2: People often sought advice from the zamindars leaders on matters of land and taxes.
meanings.sent3: It was a zamindars tradition to hold a grand feast for the entire village every harvest season.
meanings.sent4: The zamindars lifestyle was luxurious, with grand mansions and elaborate gardens.
meanings.sent5: The zamindars culture was known for its elaborate ceremonies and celebrations.
